text:
CASE: GHS-15-06001 
PATIENT: POWERPATH TEST1 
Pre-Op Diagnosis:   Two lipomas, Right upper arm 
Post-Op Diagnosis:  None Given 
Clinical History:   None Given 
 
 
 
 
 
FINAL DIAGNOSIS: 
 
A) Right upper arm biceps mass, excision: 
- Portions of mature adipose tissue (lipoma). 
B) Right upper arm triceps mass, excision: 
- Portions of mature adipose tissue (lipoma). 
 
GROSS: 
 
A) The specimen is received in formalin labeled with the patient's 
name and designated "right upper arm biceps" and consists of 2 
yellow-tan portions of fibrofatty tissue which measure 2.0 x 1.5 x 
1.3 and 1.1 x 0.4 x 0.3 cm. The larger portion is encapsulated and 
is inked.  The larger portion is serially sectioned. On section, the 
cut surface is yellow tan and homogenous. Representative sections 
are submitted in a single cassette. 
B) The specimen is received in formalin labeled with the patient's 
name and designated "right upper arm triceps" and consists of 2 
yellow-tan portions of fibrofatty tissue which measure 3.0 x 2.8 x 
1.3 and 0.8 x 0.7 x 0.4 cm. The larger portion is encapsulated and 
is inked.  The larger portion is serially sectioned. On section, the 
cut surface is yellow tan and homogenous. Representative sections 
are submitted in 2 cassettes. 
DV 9/1/2015 
 
MICROSCOPIC: 
 
Microscopic examination was performed. See diagnosis. 
 
 
The electronic signature indicates that the named Attending 
Pathologist has evaluated the specimen referred to in the signed 
section of the report and formulated the diagnosis therein. 
 
 
 
Wayne H Wirtz, MD 
Pathologist 
Electronically signed 9/3/2015 8:21:58AM
